title: Documentation map reference
description: This is used to create documentation routing and hierarchy on the nx.dev website.

content.name: Nx
content.description: Nx documentation for you to discover!

itemList.name: Getting Started
itemList.description: Get started with basic information, concepts and tutorials.

itemList.name: Tutorials
itemList.description: Get started with basic information, concepts and tutorials.

itemList.name: Core Tutorial
itemList.description: Learn to use Nx with this core tutorial where you will learn about all its main feature with a real project.

itemList.name: Angular Standalone Tutorial
itemList.description: Learn to use Nx with this Angular tutorial where you will learn about all its main feature with a real project.

itemList.name: Node Server Tutorial
itemList.description: Learn to use Nx with this Node Server Tutorial where you will learn about all its main feature with a real project.

itemList.name: Core Features
itemList.description: Learn the core features of Nx with in depth guides.

itemList.name: Run Tasks
itemList.description: Learn about the various ways you can use Nx to run tasks in your workspace.

itemList.name: Cache Task Results
itemList.description: Learn how to define cacheable tasks, how to fine-tune with inputs and outputs, where the cache is stored and much more.

itemList.name: Use Remote Caching
itemList.description: Learn how to enable remote caching s.t. you don't just benefit locally from it but also in CI.

itemList.name: Distribute Task Execution
itemList.description: Learn how to efficiently distribute tasks across machines to take full advantage of parallelization. Nx Cloud has a built-in DTE mechanism which makes this a trivial task.

itemList.name: Explore the Graph
itemList.description: Nx uses a graph behind the scenes to optimize your operations. You can also visualize and use the graph to better understand your workspace structure. Learn more in this guide.

itemList.name: Automate Updating Dependencies
itemList.description: Learn how Nx provides automated update scripts to help you keep your workspace, tooling and framework dependencies up to date.

itemList.name: Enforce Module Boundaries
itemList.description: Learn how to avoid dependency hell and scale a codebase by imposing constraints on your projects using the module boundary lint rule.

itemList.name: Integrate with Editors
itemList.description: Learn about Nx Console, an extension for VS Code and WebStorm.

itemList.name: Plugin Features
itemList.description: Learn what is a plugin, the different type of plugins and how to create one.

itemList.name: Concepts
itemList.description: Learn about all the different concepts Nx uses to manage your tasks and enhance your productivity.

itemList.name: Integrated Repos vs. Package-Based Repos vs. Standalone Apps

itemList.name: Set up Storybook for React Projects
itemList.description: This guide explains how to set up Storybook for React projects in your Nx workspace.

itemList.name: Set up Storybook for Angular Projects
itemList.description: This guide explains how to set up Storybook for Angular projects in your Nx workspace.

itemList.name: Set up Storybook for Vue Projects

itemList.name: Configuring Storybook on Nx
itemList.description: This guide explains how Storybook is configured on your Nx workspace.

itemList.name: One main Storybook instance for all projects
itemList.description: This guide explains how to consolidate all your Storybook stories from different projects into one unified Storybook instance. Ideal for Nx workspaces leveraging a single framework.

itemList.name: One Storybook instance per scope
itemList.description: This guide explains how to set up individual Storybook instances for each scope within an Nx workspace. It provides a structured approach, emphasizing folder organization and thematic scope separation.

itemList.name: One main Storybook instance using Storybook Composition
itemList.description: This guide explains how to publish a unified Storybook instance from multiple frameworks within an Nx workspace using Storybook Composition.

itemList.name: How to configure Webpack and Vite for Storybook
itemList.description: This guide explains how to customize the webpack configuration and your vite configuration for Storybook.

itemList.name: Setting up Storybook Interaction Tests with Nx
itemList.description: This guide explains how you can set up Storybook interaction tests on your Nx workspace.

itemList.name: Setting up Storybook Composition with Nx
itemList.description: This guide explains how you can set up Storybook composition on your Nx workspace.

itemList.name: Angular: Set up Compodoc for Storybook on Nx
itemList.description: This guide explains how to set up Compodoc for Storybook on Angular projects in a Nx workspace.

itemList.name: Angular: Configuring styles and preprocessor options
itemList.description: This document explains how to configure styles and preprocessor options in Angular projects with a Storybook configuration.

itemList.name: Angular: Information about the Storybook targets
itemList.description: This document explains the role of the storybook and build-storybook targets in Angular projects with a Storybook configuration, and specifically which executors are used for them.

itemList.name: Angular: The browserTarget
itemList.description: This document explains the role of the browserTarget in Angular projects with a Storybook configuration, and how the Storybook executors use it.

itemList.name: Angular: Storybook Migration to webpackFinal
itemList.description: This guide explains how migrate from older versions of Storybook which used a custom webpack.config.js to the new Storybook 6.3+ which uses the webpackFinal property in the main configuration.

itemList.name: Angular: Upgrading to Storybook 6
itemList.description: This guide explains how you can upgrade your Storybook from versions 5.3 and below to Storybook 6, for Angular projects.

itemList.name: React: Storybook Migration to webpackFinal and the Nx Addon
itemList.description: This guide explains how migrate from older versions of Storybook which used a custom webpack.config.js to the new Storybook 6.3+ which uses the webpackFinal property in the main configuration and the Nx React Addon.

itemList.name: React: Upgrading to Storybook 6
itemList.description: This guide explains how you can upgrade your Storybook from versions 5.3 and below to Storybook 6, for React projects.
